title: Hide site header on admin panel routes (/admin-panel/*) only

requirements.text: Update the shared public Layout so the global site header is not rendered on admin panel routes (any path that starts with "/admin-panel"), while keeping the header visible on all other routes (including public pages and "/admin" login).

quotes: admin panel pe hader ko hide kar do only admin penal pe

acceptanceCriteria: When navigating to any /admin-panel/* route (e.g., /admin-panel/dashboard), the global site Header component is not displayed.
When navigating to public routes like /, /about, /programs, etc., the Header remains displayed exactly as before.
When navigating to /admin (admin login), the Header remains displayed exactly as before.
No other admin panel UI elements (AdminLayout mobile header/sidebar) are removed or visually broken by this change.

constraints: Do not edit any files in frontend/src/components/ui or any paths listed as immutable in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
Keep all user-facing text in English.
nonGoals: Do not hide or change the footer behavior unless required to prevent layout breakage.
Do not change authentication or admin access logic.
Do not redesign the admin panel UI; only remove the global site header from /admin-panel/* routes.
